 Title: EU asks Meta for more details on efforts to stop Israel-Hamas war misinformation 
 Url: https://www.cnn.com/2023/10/19/tech/eu-meta-tiktok-israel-content-disinformation/index.html         n Publish Date: 2023-10-19 00:00:00 
  Excerpt from source: London CNN —

The European Union has told Meta it has a week to explain in greater detail how it is fighting the spread of illegal content and disinformation on its Facebook and Instagram platforms following the attacks across Israel by Hamas.

Here is the question: What is the most recent news in Israel?
output:
The most recent news in Israel is related to the European Union's request to Meta for more details on efforts to stop Israel-Hamas war misinformation. Meta has been given a week to explain how it is combating the spread of illegal content and disinformation on its Facebook and Instagram platforms following the attacks by Hamas.

Sources: [EU asks Meta for more details on efforts to stop Israel-Hamas war misinformation, https://www.cnn.com/2023/10/19/tech/eu-meta-tiktok-israel-content-disinformation/index.html, 2023-10-19; On Friday, Meta said its teams had been working “around the clock” since the attacks by Hamas on October 7 to monitor its platforms and outlined some of its actions against misinformation and content that violates its policies and standards.]

Here is the question: How is Netanyahu doing in Israel?
output:
As of the most recent information, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is facing public frustration and doubts about his leadership in Israel. There is popular fury over the accidental hostage killings, and Netanyahu is striving to hold on to power after the war, despite criticism that Hamas became a military power during his tenure.

Fox News reached a last-second settlement with Dominion Voting Systems on Tuesday as the case raced toward opening statements, paying more than $787 million to end a colossal two-year legal battle that publicly shredded the right-wing network’s credibility.

Fox News’ $787.5 million settlement with Dominion Voting Systems is the largest publicly known defamation settlement in US history involving a media company.'), Document(page_content='Source

Dramatic days in Delaware

Speculation of a settlement reached a fever pitch in recent days, especially after the court on Sunday announced a one-day delay to the start of the trial, which was originally set to begin on Monday.')], 'question': What happened with Fox's lawsuit against Dominion?}

Here is the question: {question}
output:
A last-second settlement has been reached in Dominion Voting Systems’ historic defamation lawsuit against Fox News, the parties announced Tuesday in court. Fox News reached a last-second settlement with Dominion Voting Systems on Tuesday, paying more than $787 million to end a colossal two-year legal battle. The settlement sends a 'strong message' to other right-wing outlets with ongoing legal disputes with Dominion. Dominion Voting Systems had two goals in its defamation case against Fox News — accountability and 'trying to make Dominion whole,' both of which were accomplished in this settlement.

Sources: [Dominion still has pending lawsuits against election deniers such as Rudy Giuliani and Sidney Powell, https://www.cnn.com/business/live-news/fox-news-dominion-trial-04-18-23/h_8d51e3ae2714edaa0dace837305d03b8, 2023-04-18 15:02:55+00:00]
